data.title: A way to pause rolling out a new version
data.body:
Not sure how simple and useful this would be, but if we had had a way to pause the rollout of 1.7.0, we could have bought us some time to make a decision and possibly build a 1.7.1 to continue the rollout with.

/cc @seanmcbreen @kieferrm @joaomoreno

data.title: Switching editor loses scroll (caret) position
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 1607

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Click an extension in "Extensions" side bar so its description is opened in an editor
  Or, click a changed file in "Git" side bar to open the diff in an editor
2. Double click the tab so the editor is kept open
3. Scroll down to some location that is not the top. Or move caret down.
4. Switch to a different editor, then switch back. The scroll position is lost and the editor shows the top of the content

data.title: Insiders will not load editors when not in a folder workspace
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.8.0-insiders installed on 11/16/2016 -- Report issue link not working so I've screenshotted the about dialog:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/494055/20371415/8a1e8664-ac19-11e6-9126-833e083e28d5.png)

- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14965
- Extensions (running with --disable-extensions)

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.0|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.9.2|
|csharp|ms-vscode|1.5.2|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.7.2|
|rewrap|stkb|0.6.3|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open Insiders (not running a workspace folder)
2. No editor or anything else loads

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/494055/20371510/2d32603c-ac1a-11e6-9aa6-9c30732a921e.png)

Opening a folder seems to work around the problem

1. Open Folder
2. Editors show up and life continues as usual
3. Close Folder
4. No editors show up again

Yesterday I added this to my user settings file:

```
"files.hotExit": true,
```

However, removing that does not seem to fix the problem.

On the plus side, hot exit seems to work when the folder is loaded.

data.title: Multi-line indents do not preserve partial indents

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.1

I'm using VSCode for Clojure editing right now and have been running into this issue a lot. This seems to be a general problem with VSCode's indentation mechanism though, and not a language specific problem. I've also verified that it's reproducible on the latest master build without any extensions or customizations applied.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set indentation to 2 spaces
2. Paste the following into an empty editor:
```
  {:key1 :value1
   :key2 :value2}
```
3. Select both lines and press tab

Expected: 

Both lines are indented by the standard indentation size of 2 spaces. This is the standard behavior in Atom, as well as most other editors I've worked with: 

![nov-16-2016 15-33-50](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6934200/20370170/1a904a8c-ac12-11e6-86ee-ec50a0fddb93.gif)

Actual:

Both lines are indented to the same indentation level, and the partial indent on the second line is discarded:

![nov-16-2016 15-16-03](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6934200/20369751/a1fe5926-ac0f-11e6-92c0-f9e4ae39b090.gif)

I tried poking around in the source code a bit but couldn't quite figure out where this functionality lives. If someone could just point me in a general direction, I can try giving it another shot.

data.title: Add custom ordering to title menu items.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Windows 8.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a new VSCode extension
2. Define commands in the package.json for "Toggle Bold", "Toggle Italics", and "Toggle Bullets", complete with icons.
3. Add these commands to the "editor/title" menu
4. Load Code with this extension installed
5. Note that the order of icons is changed, with the Bullets icon between Bold and Italic.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16612667/20369687/22fd6304-ac20-11e6-89c7-69c529751e47.png)


From what I can tell, the ordering of items is strictly by the name of the command. However, this is less than ideal, as it looks strange having Bold and Italic separated. I considered changing the names of the commands to control order, but this would look strange when presented to the user.

I ran into this issue with [my extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=mdickin.markdown-shortcuts). I ended up removing the Bullets icon until I can define the order.

data.title: Disable backups when extensions are being debugged
Emmet Expansion of `php` has unexpected behavior in `.php` files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Version 1.7.1 (1.7.1)
- OS Version: El Capitan 10.11.6 (15G1108)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open file with syntax set to php.
2. Type `php`, and press `Tab` to expand with Emmet

Expanding the string `php` with Emmet produces `<php></php>` instead of the far more helpful `<?php ?>`. I believe Sublime, Atom, etc. all address this and the `<?php ?>` expansion occurs.

data.title: electron-main/main.ts: Improve structure in the massive `main` method.
data.body:
There are probably loads of other fixes that could be made; this should be seen as a starting point and definitely something we can improve upon as we move along.

(Caveat: this is my first PR to the project. It's also one of my first TypeScript commits _ever_, so keep that in mind. I happened to see the TODO note the other day while skimming through the code, so I thought I'd give it a try since I'm very interested in seeing what TypeScript has to offer. Really, I don't think I'd ever have dared doing these kind of changes in an untyped language; the type checking really, really, _really_ makes it much easier.)

milestone.title: Backlog

data.body:
Hello, I have a new request for the vscode team.
After installing several extensions, and disabling some, I have been uncomfortable with the fact that I can´t see isolated the extensions that I have enabled. Instead with the extensions disabled the opposite happens.

In my opinion should appear by default only the extensions enabled when the extensions panel opens, and the user decides whether or not to see the disabled, which for some reason disabled them

data.title: "Go to file" when one name is a subset of another
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.1
- OS Version: Linux Mint 18

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create `abc.txt`, `alpha-beta-cappa.txt`, `xyz/index.js`, and `xerxes-yak-zubba/index.js`.
2. Hit Ctrl-P, type "abc", and hit enter. This opens `abc.txt`.
3. Hit Ctrl-P, type "xyz", and hit enter. This opens "xerxes-yak-zubba/index.js".

Also, open [DefinitelyTyped](https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped) and search for `ace/index.d.ts`. Even though this is exactly the name of a file, I get taken to `cordova-plugin-email-composer/index.d.ts` instead. I can't reproduce that in a small project.

data.title: Enhanced diff view
data.body:
Add `+` and `-` sign to the diff view editor for both side by side and inline view.

Fix #15371 .

data.title: How to assign keyboard shortcut to command with argument?
data.body:
How does one create a keyboard shortcut for a command that receives an argument? I can't seem to find any examples of keyboard shortcuts doing this. I'm presuming the `when` context handles this.

For context, here is the command:

``` ts
	vscode.commands.registerCommand('copyRelativePath', function (uri) {
		copy(vscode.workspace.asRelativePath(uri));
	});
```

Taken from https://github.com/alexandrudima/vscode-copy-relative-path/blob/293f389d9b8afc20eb0e66b8003abc131e519333/extension.js#L5

I tried the following:

``` JSON
{ "key": "alt+cmd+p", "command": "copyRelativePath", "when": "editorTextFocus" }
```

But running this shortcut gives me an error:

```
Running the contributed command:'copyRelativePath' failed.
```

Would love to know where this is documented 😄

data.title: DiagnosticCollection.set([Uri, [Diagnostic[]][]) is not reliable
data.body:
The documentation for [`DiagnosticCollection.set([Uri, Diagnostic[]][])`](http://code.visualstudio.com/docs/extensionAPI/vscode-api#DiagnosticCollection) states the following:

> Diagnostics of multiple tuples of the same uri will be merged, e.g `[[file1, [d1]], [file1, [d2]]]` is equivalent to `[[file1, [d1, d2]]]`. If a diagnostics item is `undefined` as in `[file1, undefined]` all previous but not subsequent diagnostics are removed.

However, this doesn't work in practice because the entries end up being sorted by uri, but the sort is not stable. [Here's the code that does the sort](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/c67ef57cda90b5f28499646f7cc94e8dcc5b0586/src/vs/workbench/api/node/extHostDiagnostics.ts#L77). This can result in entries being reordered so that this...

```
[file1, undefined]
[file1, [diagnostic1, diagnostic2]]
```

...becomes this...

```
[file1, [diagnostic1, diagnostic2]]
[file1, undefined]
```

That results in diagnostics being cleared when they aren't supposed to be.

data.title: Support moving the tasks framework to use the integrated terminal
data.body:
It makes sense to reuse the work of the integrated terminal in the tasks framework to leverage things like:

- Handling of ANSI control characters (colors, cursor movement)
- Multiple tasks
- Allowing input

Here are the blockers to allow this to happen:

- [x] #15583 Expose a terminal API option to pause when the shell is exited
- [x] #18376 Terminal should throw an event when a terminal has completed (and is waiting to close)
- [x] #18377 Allow terminals to be reused

No longer needed:

- #13267 ~~Allow extensions to access all terminals via API~~ (deferred as it's not a mandatory requirement and poses security/performance obstacles)
- #13337 ~~Allowing richer integration with integrated terminal (co-processes)~~ (internal API exposed for now https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/commit/7900f252ec15ffd18d1b873c35b37d7bfc9cdcfd)~~

After this is done tasks could also be moved to an extension.

data.title: Expose a terminal API option to pause when the shell is exited
data.body:
This is a requirement for the tasks framework to be moved to using the integrated terminal. The idea is to allow extensions to optionally specify they don't want the terminal to go away immediately after the shell process is exited but instead wait for input.

This would allow the tasks framework (and other extensions) to run a command that exits the shell immediately afterwards, and then wait for a keystroke or for the terminal to be killed manually, for example:

```
gulp build
...
...

Press and key to close the terminal...
```


Proposed API:

```ts
export function createTerminal(name?: string, shellPath?: string, shellArgs?: string[], waitOnExit?: boolean): Terminal;
```

/cc @jrieken @dbaeumer

data.title: Regular expression multiple cursors bug
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.1 (02611b40b24c9df2726ad8b33f5ef5f67ac30b44, 2016-11-03T13:46:00.226Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.1.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|calc|BorisA|0.0.1|
|MyExtensions|none|0.0.1|
|erb|CraigMaslowski|0.0.1|
|swift|Kasik96|0.0.2|
|calculate|acarreiro|1.1.0|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.1.0|
|prettify-json|mohsen1|0.0.3|
|Theme-TomorrowKit|ms-vscode|0.1.3|
|Ruby|rebornix|0.10.1|
|move-fast|selbh|0.1.0|
|swiftlint|shinnn|0.1.3|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a new file and type `112233445566` into it.
2. Open the find dialog and enable regex search.
3. Type `\d\d` into the search box.
4. Notice there is correctly 6 matches and hitting enter cycles through them.
5. Hit option+enter with the intention of placing 6 cursors - one on each match: `11`, `22`, `33`, `44`, `55`, `66`
6. Notice you only get 3 cursors - one on `1122` one on `3344` and one on `5566`

![image 2016-11-16 at 10 55 21 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/78082/20359088/8df9a8aa-abeb-11e6-903a-259d042737d1.png)

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.1 (02611b40b24c9df2726ad8b33f5ef5f67ac30b44, 2016-11-03T13:46:00.226Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.1.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|calc|BorisA|0.0.1|
|MyExtensions|none|0.0.1|
|erb|CraigMaslowski|0.0.1|
|swift|Kasik96|0.0.2|
|calculate|acarreiro|1.1.0|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.1.0|
|prettify-json|mohsen1|0.0.3|
|Theme-TomorrowKit|ms-vscode|0.1.3|
|Ruby|rebornix|0.10.1|
|move-fast|selbh|0.1.0|
|swiftlint|shinnn|0.1.3|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Hit cmd+f to start a search and toggle on the regex button
2. Perform a search that has multiple matches
3. Hit option+enter to place multiple cursors on all matches
4. Press cmd+f again to refocus the find bar
5. Notice that the regex you types is now gone! Replaced by a match or a previous search or something.

- VSCode Version: 1.7.1

Sorry, my English is quite poor. I tried to add callback to jsdoc without success.

data.title: Selected File in Search opens after closing and files and coming back to search
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.1 (02611b40b24c9df2726ad8b33f5ef5f67ac30b44, 2016-11-03T13:46:00.226Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.1.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|jslint|ajhyndman|1.2.1|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.1.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. In search tab, conduct a search that reveals at least one match
1. Go back to "Explorer" tab
1. Close all open files
1. Go to "Search" tab, or hit ⌘-⬆️ -F
1. Note that input focus is no longer in the search input as expected, instead the file of the first match was opened, and the match is highlighted

Rationale:

This bugged me for the _longest_ time because I had no idea why _sometimes_ my flow could be "_toggle search, start typing_", and other times it was "_toggle search, move to mouse to select search input, start typing_". Especially in the latter case, if you start typing, then you're modifying a file (which requires additional effort to undo and re-select the proper control)

The expectation is that opening the search field will **always** change focus to the search input, but if you have no files open, then this is no longer the case.

Thanks for a fantastic editor!

data.title: Track usage of internal snippet syntax
data.body:
With #3210 we are adding API to inserts snippets via completions. These snippets use the same syntax external, static snippets use which again is a subset of the TextMate snippet syntax. Eventually, we will not support the internal snippet syntax anymore.

This issue lists extensions that are known to be using the internal syntax and tracks their adoption of the new API. 

* [x] vscode.typescript - 0abf2747489e3afd263479a55c53b323742dc8ed
* [x] lukehoban.Go -> @ramya-rao-a 
* [x] vscode.javascript
* [x] rlovelett.vscode-swift-language -> https://github.com/RLovelett/vscode-swift/issues/24
* [x] vscode.css -> @aeschli 
* [x] ~~HookyQR.JSDocTagComplete -> https://github.com/HookyQR/VSCodeJSDocTagComplete/issues/2~~
* [x] vscode.json -> @aeschli 
* [x] flowtype.flow-for-vscode -> https://github.com/flowtype/flow-for-vscode/issues/51
* [x] ~~zeppelin.asp -> GONE, deleted?~~
* [x] redhat.java -> https://github.com/redhat-developer/vscode-java/issues/99
* [x] DanTup.dart-code -> https://github.com/Dart-Code/Dart-Code/issues/216
* [x] vscode.html -> @aeschli 
* [x] twxs.cmake -> https://github.com/twxs/vs.language.cmake/issues/21
* [x] AureliaEffect.aurelia -> https://github.com/aurelia/vscode-extension/issues/25
* [ ] msazurermtools.azurerm-vscode-tools -> not on GH
* [ ] mrmlnc.vscode-vash -> https://github.com/mrmlnc/vscode-vash/issues/6
